edu.ncsu.csc.coffee_maker.models.persistent

Class DomainObject<D extends DomainObject<D>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.coffee_maker.models.persistent.DomainObject<D>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - Subtype of DomainObject in question
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Inventory, Recipe

    public abstract class DomainObject<D extends DomainObject<D>>
extends java.lang.Object
    The common super-class for all database entities. This is done to centralize the logic for database saves and retrieval. When using this class, you should create an overridden getAll() method in the subclasses that passes in their class type to the DomainObject.getAll(Class cls) method so that it can perform the database retrieval. The DomainObject (this class) itself isn't persisted to the database, but it is included here as it is the root class for all persistent classes. Where applicable (ie, on retrieval requests) we use the @Transactional ( readOnly = true ) annotation which has the potential to get better performance out of the underlying database system. It is not _required_ but is better to have it than not.
    Author:
    Kai Presler-Marshall

    • Method Detail

      • copyFrom

        public void copyFrom(DomainObject other,
                     java.lang.Boolean includeId)
        When we want to perform an update, rather than deleting and re-creating, we can perform a copyFrom instead. This is advantageous because it's faster and won't break references.
        Parameters:
        other - Object to copy from
        includeId - Whether to copy the ID

      • deleteAll

        public static void deleteAll(java.lang.Class cls)
        Provides the ability to quickly delete all instances of the current class. Useful for clearing out data for testing or regeneration. Visibility is set to protected to force subclasses of DomainObject to override this.
        Parameters:
        cls - class to delete instances of

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves the DomainObject into the database. If the object instance does not exist a new record will be created in the database. If the object already exists in the DB, then the existing record will be updated.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes the selected DomainObject from the database. This is operation cannot be reversed.

      • getById

        public static DomainObject getById(java.lang.Class cls,
                                   java.lang.Object id)
        Retrieves a specific instance of the DomainObject subtype by its persistent ID
        Parameters:
        cls - class to retrieve instance of by id
        id - id of object
        Returns:
        object with given id

      • getBy

        public static DomainObject getBy(java.lang.Class cls,
                                 java.lang.String field,
                                 java.lang.String value)
        Ability to get a DomainObject of any type by any field/value provided. Will return null if the field is not valid for the DomainObject type or no record exists with the value provided.
        Parameters:
        cls - class of DomainObject
        field - The field of the object (ie, name, id, etc) requested
        value - The value for the field in question
        Returns:
        object associated with class and field

      • getId

        public abstract java.io.Serializable getId()
        Retrieves the ID of the DomainObject. May be a numeric ID assigned by the database or another primary key that is user-assigned
        Returns:
        ID of the DomainObject.
